title: How the hell do the Champion Masteries work?
body:
I done this earlier: http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/134283679/200513795?tab=overview

And got an A+, just look at my stats compared to my team, I even got most kills on the map in a one sided affair.

I than done this: http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/134411681/200513795?tab=overview

And got an S. 36/10 with 50K player damage. Is there even an S+?

replies.body: So you think purely because your team was bad in a fun featured game mode and You did average you deserve an s

I think it should base on YOUR stats, not taking into account every other player on the same game mode with the same champ.

Not my fucking fault my team sucked ass.
So, because you're incapable of attaining a *slightly* better than average score on a particular champ it's everyone else's fault?

I see it slightly differently, that is I look at the average for the game, not just this champ vs. the world.

I got on that Eve game more kills than my whole team combined amongst other stats. You would think that would be fair to reward my game based on the actual game, not based on other players not in this game, right?

It makes no sense that I don't get rewarded for having such a good game when I had 4 terrible team mates. Because, again, it is not fair that some players are always premade, some players are always doing well, whilst others like myself get stuck with players who can't play.

Riot has changed this game so much that they base everything around how well your premade team works and doesn't care at all for the solo player.

Hey,
Not sure if this was already said but a few things to consider:
-CS and objectives matter (such as last hitting drag, etc)
-Towers that your team has lost matters
-Whether you won or lost matters
-Kills (obviously) matter
Also, don't quote me on this but I've seen a few people suggest that the game actually tracks your map position in the first 20 minutes to determine what lane you are. And since, for example, a Zed mid is a common pick, you're ranked against EVERY other Zed in your reigon.
But for example if I go somewhere like Thresh jungle (xD) then my overall score and objective total would be different, making it easier to get an S.
Also, I'm pretty confident that if you play a support, it's easier to get that sweet S rank.
Hope this helps :)

[Champion Mastery](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/features/champion-mastery) is calculated based on other players' performance at that champion. That is, to get S class, you must perform in the top percentage of players on that champ in that position.

Since **Evelynn** is a popular OP pick for URF, I'd imagine the standard is quite high to get S class, whereas for **Jax** it's not as hard.

That is utterly stupid also, I mean, just look at how bad my team was. just because I didn't get better than the rest of the Eve players does not mean I don't deserve and S for playing with that team.

Be glad that Champion Mastery even works in URF. I'm personally appalled that it's not disabled for all Featured Game Modes.

Really devalues Champion Mastery for players like me who earn it in Ranked at Platinum+ level.

Take anything team related out of the equation, it's all based on the individual, which it then goes off the average gold per minute if you do well enough above the average you will get an easy s, easy way around it is to farm your face off even if you are full build, I've never not got an s if I've had 300 + Cs
